page.title: 16CLUBS
page.content: {Arbuthnott Womens Rural Institute}was founded in 1966. In 1985,membership at about 30 is strong for such a tiny community. Age range is wide,from teenagers to senior citizens. Monthly meetings,September to June,give members a chance to try varied skills. At each meeting a guest gives a talk or demonstration on anything from domestic skills such as cooking to leisure pursuits like floral art. Monthly members competitions relate to skills and techniques shown earlier. The annual flower show is held in March. Christmas and Halloween parties for local children are also organised by the WRI. Small donations to local charities are made annually. Each year ends with the trophy and prize presentations to members scoring most competition points and the appointment of the following year's committee.
